cat:scope.gco:CharacterString: Codelists for description of metadata elements compliant to S-100.

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: Subset of Alpha-3 language codes according to ISO 639-2. The Registration Authority for the alpha-3 language code elements contained in ISO 639-2 is the Library of Congress (LoC). This file uses the Terminology Codes (639-2/T). The names are as in the register maintained by the Registation Authority as of the date this list was prepared, and are given in the definition tags. Jusslandish (qjs) has been added for use with IHO "Jussland" test data sets.

description.gco:CharacterString: Defined for test purposes. In the range reserved for local use in the ISO 639-2 register.

cat:description.gco:CharacterString: Data encoding format codes for coverage and pointset data described in S-100 Parts 8 and 10c.

description.gco:CharacterString: Data at multiple discrete fixed point locations
Data at grid points forming a regular grid with constant cell spacing

Data that does not include any information that can be used to determine a cell’s geographic coordinate values, or in which cell spacing is variable, and there is no predefined association between one cell’s location and that of another
Data at sequential discrete point locations of a moving sensor platform
Data distributed over a grid with uniform cell spacing but irregular overall shape
Variable-density grid containing one or more regions with cell spacing that is a whole multiple of a common minimum uniform cell spacing

Triangulated irregular network. A TIN is a representation of a continuous surface consisting entirely of triangular facets. The vertices at the corners of each triangle are shared with the adjacent triangle. These vertices form the control points of the coverage function.
Data at multiple discrete fixed point locations organised bt station
Data at grid points forming a regular grid with constant cell spacing
